item.title: Oil Set for Third Weekly Drop on Demand Fears
item.description: Oil futures were close to 2% higher but remained on course for a third consecutive weekly decline as fears about demand have battered prices.

item.title: Metals Steady Ahead of US Jobs Data
item.description: Base metals and gold were largely unchanged ahead of the nonfarm payroll data, with investors looking to key economic indicators to see how the U.S. economy is faring amid rising interest rates.

item.title: Growing Fed-ECB Divergence Boosts Case For Higher Euro Versus Dollar
item.description: A growing divergence between the rate outlooks of the Fed and ECB “builds a stronger case for a significantly higher euro against the dollar,” Swissquote said.

item.title: Telecom Italia Seeks Higher Bids for Landline Assets
item.description: Telecom Italia said nonbinding offers it has received for its fixed-network assets from KKR and from a Macquarie-led consortium aren’t adequate enough and it has given the parties until June 9 to submit final offers.

item.title: Thales's Strong 1Q Bodes Well for the Year
item.description: Higher sales and order intake for Thales show the aerospace-and-defense company is tracking slightly ahead of its guidance, a development that bodes well for the full year, Berenberg said.

item.title: IAG Returns to Profit as Demand Rebounds
item.description: IAG reported a surprise underlying profit of €9 million in the first quarter and raised its earnings guidance for the year on strong demand, with 2023 capacity seen at around 97% of prepandemic levels.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Increase as More ECB Rate Rises to Come
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields edged higher, reversing some of Thursday’s moves, as investors acknowledged the ECB’s message of more interest-rate rises.

item.title: German Manufacturing Orders Tumble
item.description: New orders at German factories fell by a worse-than-expected 10.7% in March after rising by a downwardly revised 4.5% in February, signaling sliding demand for goods as concerns over the health of the global economy mount.

item.title: Adidas Shares Climb on Forecast-Beating Sales
item.description: Shares in Adidas furthered their rally after the group said first-quarter organic sales remained stable on the year at €5.3 billion, and that high inventory levels have eased to some extent.

item.title: Air France-KLM Cuts Capacity Target as First Quarter Falls Short
item.description: Air France-KLM reported narrower losses in the first quarter but which fell short of expectations, and slightly lowered its capacity forecast for the year ahead despite strong ticket sales that lifted revenue.

item.title: CaixaBank Profits Top Forecasts
item.description: CaixaBank said its first-quarter net profit was €855 million, as net interest income rose 49%, helped by higher interest rates.

item.title: U.S. Companies in China Worry Due Diligence Will End in Spy Dramas
item.description: Foreign companies are walking a tightrope between their need for business intelligence to comply with U.S. sanctions and mounting concerns about the risks of carrying out due diligence.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: A jury found four leading figures of the Proud Boys, including its former chairman Enrique Tarrio, guilty of seditious conspiracy, the gravest charge brought in connection with the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol.
item.description: A jury found four leading figures of the Proud Boys, including its former chairman Enrique Tarrio, guilty of seditious conspiracy, the gravest charge brought in connection with the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol.

item.title: Paramount Global posted a steep first-quarter loss and said it would cut its dividend, sending the media company's shares down nearly 30%.
item.description: Paramount Global posted a steep first-quarter loss and said it would cut its dividend, sending the media company’s shares down nearly 30%.

item.title: Moscow accused the U.S. of organizing this week's drone attack on the Kremlin, while Washington denied any involvement and began its own investigation into what happened.
item.description: Moscow accused the U.S. of organizing this week’s drone attack on the Kremlin, while Washington denied any involvement and began its own investigation into what happened.

item.title: Apple reported its second straight quarter of declining revenue but said iPhone sales surged due to strong demand in emerging markets, a sign of resilience as the company faces economic uncertainty.
item.description: Apple reported its second straight quarter of declining revenue but said iPhone sales surged due to strong demand in emerging markets, a sign of resilience as the company faces economic uncertainty.

item.title: The ECB slowed the pace of its interest-rate increases but signaled it isn't ready to pause its campaign against high inflation, diverging from the Fed.
item.description: The ECB slowed the pace of its interest-rate increases but signaled it isn’t ready to pause its campaign against high inflation, diverging from the Fed.

item.title: Regional-bank stocks sank despite assurances from the Fed that the banking system is on a solid footing. Shares of PacWest Bancorp, hit hard since the collapses of several lenders, dropped by about 50%.
item.description: Regional-bank stocks sank despite assurances from the Fed that the banking system is on a solid footing. Shares of PacWest Bancorp, hit hard since the collapses of several lenders, dropped by about 50%.

item.title: Wegovy's maker said it would temporarily hold back some starter doses of the obesity drug in the U.S. to protect supplies for current users.
item.description: Wegovy’s maker said it would temporarily hold back some starter doses of the obesity drug in the U.S. to protect supplies for current users.
